block.docTitle: An Act of Parliament to provide for the collection, compilation, analysis and publication of statistical information, and for the taking of censuses, and for matters connected with the foregoing and incidental thereto

1.General Information
(1) Name of owner.
(2) Postal address.
(3) Name of firm.
(4) Location of mill or factory.
2.Information concerning Raw Materials Used
(1) Raw materials used.
(2) Source or sources.
(3) Location of suppliers.
(4) Form in which received.

3.Information concerning Products Manufactured and Markets Supplied
(1) Products manufactured.
(2) Quantities manufactured.
(3) Markets supplied (the quantity of each product supplied to each market to be given).
4.Information concerning Buildings
(1) Type:
(a) Mill or factory building (to be subdivided by function).
(b) Dwelling-houses.
(c) Workmen's accommodation.
(2) Details of each type:
(a) Number.
(b) Structure.
(c) Age.
(d) Floor area.
(e) Value -
(i) original value;
(ii) depreciation per cent;
(iii) present value.
(f) Condition.
5.Information concerning Machinery
(1) Types:
(a) Power units.
(b) Manufacturing machinery, including ancillary machinery such as mechanical saw sharpeners.
(c) Vehicles.
(2) Individual machines of each type (to be listed and the following particulars given concerning each machine):
(a) Name of manufacturer.
(b) Age.
(c) Horse power required.
(a) Value -
(i) original value;
(ii) depreciation per cent;
(iii) present value.
(e) Condition.
6.Information concerning Personnel
(1) Categories:
(a) Director.
(b) Partner.
(c) Manager.
(d) Foreman.
(e) Tradesmen.
(f) Labourer.
(g) Clerical staff.
(2) Particulars Required:
(a) Number in each category.
(b) Salary, wages and bonus payments of each category.
(c) Value of travelling, subsistence and housing allowances, where given.
(d) Hours worked by each category.
(e) Housing facilities available to each category.
(f) Details of First Aid facilities available.
(g) Details of accident prevention measures and safety precautions taken.
7.Information concerning Costs
(1) Cost of Raw Materials:
(a) Purchase price.
(b) Cost of haulage to mill or factory.
(c) Other costs incurred prior to delivery to mill or factory.
(2) Manufacturing Costs (to be subdivided to show the cost of each individual operation or process).
(3) Marketing Costs:
(a) Cost of transport to market.
(b) Selling agents and/or salesmen's remuneration.
(4) Overhead Cost.
8.Information concerning Rates of Production
(1) Maximum productive capacity per month of mill or factory.
(2) Current production.
9.Information concerning Value of Product
Selling Prices of Products:
(a) Ex mill or factory.
(b) On main domestic market.
(c) On export market.
10.Information concerning Capital Employed
(1) Total stock or share capital.
(2) Total loan capital.
(3) Value of stocks of logs and sawn timber.
(4) Value of stocks of spare parts and stores.
11.Information concerning Capital Requirements
(1) Loan.
(2) Stock or share.

section.heading: SECTION THE STATISTIC (QUARTERLY BUSINESS EXPECTATIONS) REGULATIONS.

xhtml:td.xhtml:p: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Statistics (Quarterly Business Expectations) Regulations.
2. In these Regulations, except where the context otherwise requires -
"person in charge", in relation to an undertaking, means the person who, whether as owner, agent or manager, controls or manages the undertaking;

"undertaking" means any trade or business engaged, whether solely or in connexion with any other activity, in mining, quarrying, manufacture, construction, generation, processing or repair of any mineral, article or thing, or in commerce distributing, transporting, storing or communicating any article or thing, or in rendering a service to any other undertaking or individual.
3. The person in charge of an undertaking may be required by an authorized officer to make a return containing the particulars and information specified in the Schedule.

4. Any person required by an authorized officer to make a return under regulation 3 shall do so within fifteen days, or such longer period as the authorized officer requiring the return to be made may allow, from the day on which he receives the form required to be completed.
5. All returns under these Regulations shall be made to the Director of Statistics, P.O. Box 30266, Nairobi.

6. An authorized officer may require any person who has made any return under these Regulations to supply him, whether by answering questions or otherwise as the officer sees fit, with such further information as may, in the opinion of the officer, be necessary to enable him to ascertain whether the matters and particulars stated in that person's return are fully and accurately furnished.
SCHEDULE
THE QUARTERLY BUSINESS EXPECTATIONS REGULATIONS
1. Particulars of -
(a) value of sales or receipts during the period;
(b) value of stocks at end of the period;
(c) expenditure on new capital assets during the period;
(d) number of employees at end of period;
the period being the immediate past quarter of the calendar year.
2. Particulars of expected -
(a) value of sales during the specified periods;
(b) value of stocks at end of specified periods;
(c) expenditure on new capital assets during the specified periods;
(d) number of employees at end of specified periods;
the specified periods may be -
(i) the current quarter of the calendar year;
(ii) the next quarter of the calendar year;
(iii) the whole of the current calendar year;
(iv) the whole of the next calendar year;
(v) the whole of the next but one calendar year.

section.heading: SECTION THE STATISTICS (SURVEY OF SUGAR-CANE PRODUCTION) REGULATIONS.

xhtml:p.xhtml:b: THE STATISTICS (SURVEY OF SUGAR-CANE PRODUCTION) REGULATIONS

xhtml:td.xhtml:p: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Statistics (Survey of Sugar-Cane Production) Regulations.
2. In these Regulations -
"factory" means any registered establishment the purpose of which is production of white sugar from sugar-cane;
"grower" means the owner, lessee, manager, caretaker or any other person or group of persons responsible for the growing of sugar-cane for use in a factory.
3. Any grower may be required by an authorized officer to make a return in the forms contained in the Schedule of the matters and particulars stated therein.

4. A grower to whom forms are sent by an authorized officer to make a return under regulation 3 shall do so within seven days from the date of receipt of such forms or within such longer period as the authorized officer may allow.

5. All returns under these Regulations shall be made to the
authorized officer at such place and by such means as he may specify.

6. An authorized officer may require a grower who has made a return to provide him with such further information as may be necessary for ascertaining the accuracy of the matters and particulars stated in that grower's return.

section.heading: SECTION THE STATISTICS ( SURVEY OF SMALL-SCALE FARMS) REGULATIONS.

xhtml:p.xhtml:b: THE STATISTICS (SURVEY OF SMALL-SCALE FARMS) REGULATIONS

xhtml:td.xhtml:p: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Statistics (Survey of Small-Scale Farms) Regulations.
2. In these Regulations, unless the context otherwise requires -
"person in charge", in relation to any small-scale farm, means the person who, whether as owner, agent or manager, controls or manages the farm; and"
"small-scale farm" has the meaning assigned to it under the Agriculture Act. Cap. 318.

3. Every person in charge of a small-scale farm may be required by an authorized officer to make a return in one or more of the forms contained in the Schedule of the matters and particulars stated therein.

4. Every person required by the authorized officer to make any returns under regulation 3 shall do so within such period, and subject
to such instructions as may be specified by the authorized officer
requiring the returns to be made.

5. An authorized officer may require any person who has made any returns under these Regulations to supply him, whether by answering questions or otherwise, as the authorized officer may see fit, with such further information as may, in the opinion of the officer, enable him to ascertain whether the matters and the particulars stated in the returns are fully and accurately furnished.

6. For the purposes of Form Four in the Schedule the person in charge shall give the authorized officer reasonable access into the farm so as to enable the officer to survey the farm and its various crop fields using a prismatic compass and a measuring wheel.

1. These Regulations may be cited as the Statistics (Building) Regulations.
2. In these Regulations, except where the context otherwise requires -
"extension of a building" means a construction, completed within three years of me date of the return required under these Regulations, extending or altering an existing building;
"new building" means a building the construction of which has been completed within three years of the date of the return required by these Regulations other than -

(a) a temporary structure erected for the purpose of constructing a new building, or an extension of a building, and intended to be demolished prior to or on the completion of the new building or extension of a building;
(b) an extension of a building.

3. Any owner of a new building or extension of a building may be required by an authorized officer to make a return, in the form of the Schedule, containing the matters and particulars required therein relating to the new building or extension of a building.

4. Every person required by an authorized officer to make a return under regulation 3 shall do so within fifteen days, or such longer period as the authorized officer requiring the return to be made may allow, from the day on which he receives the form required to be completed, and each such return shall be made to the authorized officer requiring it.

5. An authorized officer may require any person who has made a return under these Regulations to supply him, whether by answering questions or otherwise as .the officer sees fit, with such further information as may, in the opinion of the officer, be necessary to enable him to ascertain whether the matters and particulars stated in that person's return are fully and accurately furnished.

FORM BS/73
BUILDING STATISTICS

(Please read these notes carefully before attempting to complete the form)
GENERAL NOTES
1.Authority
These statistics are collected under the authority of the Statistics Act (Cap. 112), and the Statistics (Building) Regulations.
Under these Regulations an owner of a new building or of an extension or alteration of an existing building is required to make a return in the following form.
2.Confidentiality of the Information
Information supplied on this form is confidential to the Central Bureau of Statistics, and will be used for statistical purposes only.
3.Completion and Return of the Form

The completed form should be returned to the authorized officer of the appropriate municipality or other local authority where it was issued for onward transmission to the Director of Statistics, Central Bureau of Statistics, P.O. Box 30266, Nairobi.
4.Type of Building
"Residential" does not include hotels, hostels, etc., which should be shown under item 3 (b) (v).
5.Date Plan Approved

This should be the actual date on which the plan was approved by the appropriate Municipality or other local authority and not the date on which the plan was submitted. The not be included, nor should the cost of land.
7.Floor Area
This should include ancillary buildings such as store-rooms, lavatories, garages, verandas, outhouses, etc.
8.Habitable Room
This should be construed to mean any room used for the of working, living or sleeping other than a kitchen, bathroom, passage, lavatory, laundry-room, etc.
9 Self-contained Residential Unit
This means a house, flat or maisonette designed for use exclusively as one contained residence together with buildings ancillary thereto (seeNote 7).

section.heading: SECTION THE STATISTICS ( AGRICULTURAL CREDIT ) REGULATIONS

xhtml:tr.xhtml:td:
THE STATISTICS (AGRICULTURAL CREDIT) REGULATIONS
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Statistics (Agricultural Credit) Regulations.
2. In these Regulations, except where the context otherwise requires -
"person in charge", in relation to an undertaking, means the person who, whether as owner, agent or manager, controls or manages the undertaking; and
"undertaking" means any business which deal's wholly or partly in agricultural credit business.
3. The person in charge of an undertaking may be required by an authorized officer to make a return containing the particulars and _ information relating to the subjects specified in the Schedule hereto.
4. Any person required by an authorized officer to make a return under regulation 3 shall do so within thirty days from the day on which he receives the form required to be completed, or such longer period as the authorized officer requiring the return to be made may allow, and all returns under these Regulations shall be made to the Director of Statistics, Central Bureau of Statistics, P.O. Box 30266, Nairobi.
5. Any authorized officer may require any person who has made a return under these Regulations to supply him, whether by answering questions or otherwise as the officer sees fit, with such further information as may, in the opinion of the officer, be necessary to enable him to ascertain whether the matters and particulars stated in that person's return are fully and accurately furnished.

xhtml:td.xhtml:p: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Statistics (Rent Survey) Regulations.
2. In these Regulations, except where the context otherwise requires -
"owner", in relation to a dwelling unit, means the person who, whether as owner, tenant, manager or caretaker, occupies or manages the dwelling unit; and
"dwelling unit" means any building used for residential purposes.

3. The owner of a dwelling unit may be required by the authorized officer to make a return containing the particulars and information relating to the subjects specified in the First or Second Schedules, whichever is appropriate.

4. Any person required by an authorized officer to make a return under regulation 3 shall do so within such time as the authorized officer requiring the return to be made may allow, and all returns under these Regulations shall be made to the Director of Statistics, Central Bureau of Statistics, P.O. Box 30266, Nairobi.

5. An authorized officer may require any person who has made a return under these Regulations to supply him, whether by answering questions or otherwise as the officer sees fit, with such further information as may, in the opinion of the officer, be necessary to enable him to ascertain whether the matters and particulars stated in the return are fully and accurately furnished.

FIRST SCHEDULE

CENTRAL BUREAU OF STATISTICS

BASELINE RENT SURVEY, 19....... .
GENERAL NOTES

1.Authority
This survey is undertaken under the authority of the Statistics Act and the Statistics (Rent Survey) Regulations. Under these Regulations an owner/tenant of a dwelling unit is required to supply the information requested on this form.

2.Purpose of the Survey
The survey is undertaken annually/half yearly in some selected major towns by the Central Bureau of Statistics, in order to obtain information to compute the value of residential housing, whether owner-occupied or rented, and to compile a profile on housing in the country.

3.Confidentiality of the Information
Information supplied on this form is confidential to the Central Bureau of Statistics and is not to be published or divulged in a format which makes it possible to identify details of individual respondents.

4.Identification
The interviewing officer is supplied with an official letter of identification and is instructed to produce it on demand.

5.Difficulties
For any queries, please contact your respective Provincial Statistics Office or telephone
the Director, Central Bureau of Statistics - Nairobi 333970 or write to P.O. Box 30266,
Nairobi.

SCHEDULE
CONFIDENTIAL

MONTHLY SURVEY OF INDUSTRIAL PRODUCTION
PART I - GENERAL REMARKS
1.Authority
These statistics arc collected winder the authority of the Statistics Act (Cap. 112), and the Statistics (Monthly Survey of Industrial Production) Regulations
2.Scope of the Inquiry and the Objective
This inquiry is intended to cover all firms located in Kenya which are engaged in mining, quarrying, manufacturing and generation and/or distribution of electricity.
The objective of the survey is to provide data that will be used, together with other available data, for economic planning in the country.
3.Confidentiality of the Information
Information supplied on this form is confidential to the Central Bureau of Statistics,
The information will be used for statistical purposes only.
4.Completion and Return of Form

Please answer all questions and mail one copy of this form, post free, by sticking the enclosed blue Official Reply Service label in front of the envelope, to the Director of Statistics Central Bureau of Statistics, P.O. Box 30266, Nairobi.

5. Difficulties
Should you have any difficulties in completing this form, please write to the above address or telephone Nairobi 333970 Extensions 225, 230 and 246.
PART II - NOTES
1.Commodities
The list of commodities entered on Part IV of this form may not be complete and therefore you are required to include all important items omitted.
2.Unit of Measurement
The unit of measurement specified beside each quantity should be adhered to strictly in respect of the quantity of each commodity.
3. Value of Production
The value of production of each commodity should be the actual manufacturing cost of that item.

THE STATISTICS (HOTELS, LODGING AND ROOMING
HOUSES) REGULATIONS

xhtml:td.xhtml:p: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Statistics (Hotels, Lodging and Rooming Houses) Regulations.
2. In these Regulations, except where the context otherwise requires -
"hotel" has the meaning assigned to it by section 2 of the Hotels and Restaurants Act;
"person in charge" in relation to a hotel means the person who, whether as owner, agent, or manager, controls or manages the hotel.

3. Any person in charge of a hotel may be required by an authorized officer to make a return for any calendar month in the form specified in the Schedule of the matters and particulars stated therein.

4. Any person required by an authorized officer to make any return under regulation 3 shall do so not later than the fifth day of the following month, or such longer period as the authorized officer requiring the return to be made may allow, from the end of the month to which the form required to be completed refers, and all returns under these Regulations shall be made to the Director of Statistics, Central Bureau of Statistics. P.O. Box 30266, Nairobi.

5. An authorized officer may require any person who has made a return under these Regulations to supply him, whether by answering questions or otherwise as the officer sees fit, with such further information as may, in the opinion of the officer, be necessary to enable him to ascertain whether the matters and particulars stated in that person's return are fully and accurately furnished.

1. AUTHORITY -
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Statistics (Air Traffic) Regulations.
2. (1) In these Regulations, except where the context otherwise requires -
"aerodrome" or "airport" means an aerodrome licensed for public use;
"air service" means an air service using one or more aircraft operated by a public or commercial undertaking for hire or reward;
"class" includes first class, tourist class, coach class, or any other passenger accommodation class on an aircraft which may be introduced in an air service from time to time;
"dead load" includes live animals;
"freight" includes a dead load put down or picked up, cargo freight, and diplomatic mail, but excludes passengers' baggage;
"internal air movement" means a movement which is the whole or part of a flight wholly within Kenya;
"international air movement" means a movement which is part of a flight to or from an aerodrome outside Kenya;

"movement" includes each touch-down at an aerodrome or arrival from another aerodrome by an aircraft, and each take-off from an aerodrome to another aerodrome, unless after take-off the aircraft is required for mechanical or other reasons to land again on the same aerodrome from which it took off;

"operator" in relation to an air service, means the representative of the undertaking operating that air service or his duly authorized agent responsible for the management of aircraft movements relating to that air service at an aerodrome within Kenya;
(2) For the purposes of these Regulations aircraft movements shall be classified as -
(a) scheduled;
(b) scheduled diverted;
(c) chartered;
(c - ) chartered diverted;
(e) freight;
(f) testing;
(g) training; or
(h) position proving,
as may be appropriate.
(3) Any passenger or freight arriving at an aerodrome in an aircraft shall be deemed to be in transit if the passenger or freight is to continue the journey in the same aircraft.

3. (1) An authorized officer may require an operator to make a return containing the particulars and information set out in the Forms set out in the Schedule, as may be appropriate, in respect of the movements of all aircraft of the air service for which he is responsible.
(2) An operator shall make separate returns in respect of -
(a) the operations of such aircraft at each aerodrome;
(b) each route; and
(c) each calendar month.
(3) Returns relating to international air movements shall be made in the forms specified as Airstat Forms A and B and set out in the Schedule.

4. Any operator required by an authorized officer to make a return in accordance with regulation 3 shall do so within seven days of receipt of the forms required to be completed, or such longer period as the authorized officer may direct, and the return shall be addressed to the Director of Statistics, Central Bureau of Statistics, P.O. Box 30266, Nairobi.

5. An authorized officer may require any person who made a return under these Regulations to provide him, whether by answering questions or otherwise, with such further information as may, in the opinion of the officer, be necessary to ensure that the particulars and information required are fully and accurately furnished.

section.heading: SECTION THE STATISTICS (SURVEY OF SERVICES) REGULATIONS, 1986

xhtml:tr.xhtml:td: 1. These Regulations may he cited as the Statistics (Survey of Services) Regulations, 1986.

2. In these Regulations, unless the context otherwise requires, "person in charge", in relation to a business, establishment or undertaking, means the person who whether as owner, agent or manager controls or manages the business or undertaking.

3. A person in charge of an undertaking, business or establishment may be required by an authorized officer to make a return containing the particulars and information relating to any subject specified in either or all the forms set in the Schedule.

4. Any person required by an authorized officer to make a return under regulation 3 shall do so within thirty days from the day of which he receives the form required to be completed, or within such longer period as the authorized officer requiring the return to be made may allow, and all returns under these Regulations shall be made to the Director of Statistics, Central Bureau of Statistics, Ministry of Planning and National Development, P.O. Box 30266, Nairobi.

6. The Statistics (Survey of Services) Regulations, 1976, are
revoked.

3. FIRMS WITH MORE THAN ONE ESTABLISHMENT
Details of all establishment undertakings or businesses may be included in single return although a separate return may be made for each.
4. PERIOD COVERED BY THE RETURN
Statistics are required for the calendar year 1985. If information cannot be given for the period, please enter figures for the year ending before or after June 1985.

All correspondences should be sent to:
The Director of Statistics, Central Bureau of Statistics, P.O. Box 30266, Nairobi. No postage is payable if the enclosed official reply service label is used.

Establishments outside Nairobi may contact the Bureau's district offices.
8. Confidential Nature of the Inquiry
Your return will be used for statistical purpose, only and shall not be used for purpose of taxation or investigation.

1. VALUE OF PURCHASES
The valuation of purchases should include duties and handling charges, but exclude discounts and duty drawbacks.
2. MATERIALS USED
This heading covers all materials purchased and used by the the establishment providing services, whether they are subsequently sold to the customer after being worked on (as in the case of food) or are consumed as an integral part of providing the services (as with replacement crockery, linen, medicines or photographic processing chemicals). In general include all materials purchased which do not fall in the in category 9 (c), (d), (e) or (f).

3. COST OF GOODS SOLD
This heading covers, for example purchases of goods for bar sa1es in restaurants and hotels, cameras, film and accessories for re-sale by photographers and cosmetics and beauty aids for sale by hair-dressers.
4 SHARE OF HEAD OFFICE COSTS
(Applies only to establishments which fill in more than one form (-seepart 1 note 3).You should ignore this item if the relevant expenditures are already included under the other headings.

5. VALUE OF SALES AND WORK DONE
Sales should include excise duty but exclude rebates and discounts,

6. CONTRIBUTIONS
This refers to payments by members of a society or club.

7. NET PROFIT

THE STATISTICS (KENYA MAN-POWER SURVEY)
REGULATIONS, 1972
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Statistics (Kenya Man­
power Survey) Regulations, 1972.
2. In these Regulations, except where the context otherwise
requires­
"employee" includes any person in receipt of remuneration from
employment whether as director, manager, agent, or otherwise, but
does not include a business proprietor or any consular trade or other
representative of a foreign government, or members of the armed
force
"family worker" means any person actively engaged in the daily
who does not receive a regular wage or salary; and
"self-employed" means persons or partners working for their own
account.
3. (1) Every employer may be required by an authorized officer
to make 'a return or returns in one or more of the matters contained
in the Schedule to these Regulations of the matters and particulars
stated in respect of all employees who on the 3rd January, 1972, were
in his employment or in his register of employment.
(2) Every self-employed person may be required by an authorized:.
officer to make a return or returns in the form contained in the
Schedule to these Regulations of the matters and particulars stated
therein in respect of all partners, proprietors and family workers not
hired on a regular wage contract, who on the 3rd January, 1972,
actively participated in the operation of the business.
(3) Where an employer or self-employed person who is required to make make any return
make any return or returns under this Regulations ha establishments operating in more than one district, or if he operates separate branches
district or if he operates separate branches in different industries , a separate return required
or returns as required by paragraph (1) of this regulation shall be made by him
in respect of his establishments in each such district.
(4) Every person required by an authorized officer to make any returns under Regulation 3 of these Regulations
under regulation 3 of these Regulations shall do so, when for
, shall do so, when for the purpose of collecting the return he is visited by an authorized officer.
(5) The authorized officer may require an employer or self-employed person who has made any returns
under these Regulations to supply him, whether by answering questions or otherwise as the
officer may see fit, with such further information as may, in the opinion of the officer, enable
him to ascertain whether the matters, and particulars stated in the return are fully and accurately furnished.
(6) The Statistics (Kenya 'Manpower Survey) Regulations, 196",L.N.151/1967.

section.heading: SECTION THE STATISTICS (KENYA MANPOWER SURVEY) REGULATIONS, 1982

foreign.xhtml:div:
THE STATISTICS (KENYA MANPOWER SURVEY) REGULATIONS, 1982
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Statistics (Kenya Man­power Survey) Regulations 1982, and shall be deemed to have come into operation on the 25th October, 1982.
2. In these Regulations, unless the context otherwise requires - "employee" means a person in receipt of remuneration from employment whether as a director, manager, agent or otherwise but does not include a sole trader, a consular, trade or other representative of a foreign government, a member of the armed forces, or any person actively engaged in the daily operation of an establishment owned by a member of his family and who does not receive a regular wage or salary;
"employer" means a person who engages employees at an establishment;
"establishment" means any place where an economic activity is carried on.
"self-employed person" includes a sole trader, and a partner in a partnership.
"working hours" include shift hours.
3. There shall be such periodical surveys, known as manpower surveys, as the Director may direct but no survey shall be conducted until an employer or establishment or self-employed person likely to be affected thereby has received notice thereof in writing from the Director.
4. (1) An authorized officer may, during the working hours at any establishment, visit the establishment and require the employer or other responsible person to make available such employees as the authorized officer deems may be interviewed to supply information on the matters specified in the First Schedule with respect to that establishment.
(2) An authorized officer may at any reasonable time visit a self-employed person and require such information as he may deem necessary from that person for the purposes of these Regulations.
(3) The information supplied pursuant to paragraphs (1) and (2) shall be recorded in the return in Form 1 in the Second Schedule by the authorized officer at the time of visiting an establishment or a self-employed person.
5. An authorized officer may in addition to any interview con­ducted under regulation 4 require an employer or self-employed person to produce such employment records for inspection and to furnish such other information as the authorized officer may deem necessary to enable him effectively complete a return fully and accurately.
6. The Director may at any time require that with respect to any establishment in respect of which a survey has been conducted under regulations 4 and 5 a further survey shall be conducted by requiring all affected employers to complete the return in Form 2 in the Second Schedule and return it to the Director of Statistics, P.O. Box 30266, Nairobi or to an authorized officer where the Director so requires in writing.
7. The Statistics (Kenya Manpower Survey) Regulations, 1972, are revoked.

FIRST SCHEDULE (reg. 4)
Matters on which employees shall be interviewed­
1. Name.
2. Occupation.
3. Sex, age and nationality.
4. Education, particularly the highest level of formal education reached.
5. Vocational background: the institutions attended, the period spent at the institutions, the examinations passed and certificates obtained.
6. Apprenticeship, if any, formal or informal.
7. Date when hired in the post held as at the time of the survey.
8. Date of promotion to post held at the time of the survey. 9. Period of experience in the same or similar occupation.
10. The number of persons supervised, if any.
11. Previous employers, if any.
12. The monthly gross cash remuneration at the time of the survey.
13. Previous monthly gross cash remuneration in other or the same employment.14. Whether the employee is housed by the employer or not

xhtml:td.xhtml:p: THE STANDARDS (No. 3) ORDER, 1982
1. This Order may be cited as the Standards (No. 3) Order, 1982.
2. Kenya Standards having been declared for the several commodities
and methods and procedures set out in the first and second columns
of the Schedule, no person shall manufacture or sell those commodities
or use those methods and procedures on or after a date which is six
weeks after the date of publication of this Order unless the commodities
and methods and procedures comply with the requirements
of the relevant Kenya Standards.

foreign.xhtml:div: 1.This Act may be cited as the Statistics Act.

3.(1) There shall be a Director of Statistics.
(2) Subject to the approval of the Minister, the Director may from time to time, by writing under his hand, appoint any person to be an authorized officer for the purposes of this Act, and may delegate to any person that power of appointment.

4.The Director shall -
(a) collect, compile, analyse and abstract, and, subject to the general or special directions of the Minister, publish, statistical information relating to the matters specified in the First Schedule:
Provided that no such information shall be collected until regulations have been made under section 13 (a);
(b) give effect to any order made under section 5.

5.(1) The Minister may from time to time, as he considers necessary, by order direct that a census shall be taken for Kenya, or for any part thereof, or in respect of any class of inhabitants thereof.
(2) An order made under this section may specify -
(a) the date or dates on or between which the census is to be taken; and
(b) the persons by whom and with respect to whom the returns for the purpose of the census are to be made; and
(c) the information to be obtained in the census.

6.(1) Where any census is being taken or any statistical information is being collected under this Act. an authorized officer may, in the manner specified in subsection (2), require any person to supply him with such particulars as may be prescribed or such of those particulars as the Director may consider necessary or desirable in relation to the taking of the census or the collection of the information; and on being so required that person shall, to the best of his knowledge, information and belief, complete such forms, make such 3 returns, answer such questions and give all such information, in such manner and within such time as may be specified by the authorized officer in accordance with regulations made under section 13.
(2) An authorized officer may require any person to supply him with particulars either by interviewing the person or by leaving at or posting to his last known address a form having thereon or attached thereto a notice requiring the form to be completed and returned in such manner and within such time as shall be specified in the notice.
(3) Where any particulars are, by any document issued by an authorized officer, required to be supplied by any person, it shall be presumed until the contrary is proved that the particulars may lawfully be required from that person in accordance with this Act.

8.Except for the purposes of a prosecution under this Act -
(a) no individual return or part thereof made for the purposes of this Act;
(b) no answer given to any question put for the purposes of this Act; and
(c) no report, abstract or document, containing particulars contained in any such return or answer and so arranged as to render possible the identification of those particulars with any person, business or undertaking,
shall be published, admitted in evidence or shown to any person not employed in the execution of a duty under this Act, unless consent in writing thereto has been obtained from the person making the return or giving the answer, or, in the case of a business or undertaking, from the person having the control, management or superintendence of the business or undertaking:
Provided that nothing in this section shall prevent or restrict the publication of any report, abstract or document without consent where the particulars therein render identification possible merely by reason of the fact that they relate to a business or undertaking which is the only business or undertaking within its particular sphere of activities, so, however, that in no case shall those particulars render possible identification of the costs of production of, or the capital employed or profits arising in, that business or undertaking.

9.(1) Any person employed in the execution of a duty under this Act who -
(a) by virtue of his employment or duty becomes possessed of information which might influence or affect the market value of any share or other security, interest, product or article and who, before the information is made public, directly or indirectly uses it for personal gain; or
(b) without lawful authority publishes or communicates to any person otherwise than in the ordinary course of his employment any information acquired by him in the course of his employment or duty; or
(c) knowingly compiles for issue any false statistics or information, shall be guilty of an offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding one year or to a fine not exceeding ten thousand shillings, or to both.
(2) Any person who, being in possession of any information which to his knowledge has been disclosed in contravention of this Act, publishes or communicates that information to any other person shall be guilty of an offence and liable to imprisonment for a term not exceeding one year or to a fine not exceeding ten thousand shillings, or to both.
(3) Any person who -
(a) hinders or obstructs an authorized officer in the lawful performance of any duties or in the lawful exercise of any powers imposed or conferred upon him under this Act; or
(b) refuses or neglects -
(i) to complete and supply, within such time as may be specified in that behalf, the particulars required in any return, form or other document left with or sent to him; or
(ii) to answer any question or inquiries put to or made of him, . under this Act; or
(c) knowingly or recklessly makes in any return, form or other document completed by him under this Act, or in any answer to any question or inquiry put to or made of him under this Act, any statement which is untrue in any material particular, shall be guilty of an offence and liable to a fine not exceeding two thousand shillings or to imprisonment for a term not exceeding three months, or to both.

section.heading: SECTION 10 Oath of office and secrecy.

foreign.xhtml:div:
10.Every person employed in the execution of any duty under this Act shall, before entering on his duties, make and subscribe before a magistrate or commissioner for oaths an oath in the form set out in the Second Schedule:
Provided that in the case of a person employed as an enumerator in a census it shall be sufficient if he makes in any language approved by the Director, and delivers or transmits to an authorized officer, a written declaration in the same form, substituting for the words "do solemnly swear" the word "declare".

11.The Director may at the request of any person and upon payment of such fee as the Director, with the consent of the Minister, may specify, or as may be prescribed, supply to that person any special information or report concerning, or carry out for that person any special investigation into, any of the matters specified in the First Schedule.
12.The expenses incurred for the purposes of this Act by the Minister and the Director shall be defrayed out of moneys provided by Parliament.

xhtml:div.xhtml:p: 13.The Minister may make regulations for the better carrying into effect of the provisions of this Act, and in particular, but without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing, may -

(a) prescribe the particulars to be furnished in relation to any matter in respect of which statistical information may be collected under paragraph (a) of section 4;
(b) prescribe the manner and form in which, the times and places at which and the persons by whom particulars and information shall be furnished;
(c) make additions to or deletions from, or otherwise vary, the matters specified in the First Schedule.
